content: One example of a collaboration that is considered to have damaged an artist's reputation is Lou Reed and Metallica's joint album, "Lulu," released in 2011. The collaboration between the legendary rock singer-songwriter and the heavy metal band was highly anticipated, but the album was met with widespread criticism and panned by critics and fans alike. Many felt that the sound and style of the album did not mesh well and that the project was a misstep for both artists. The negative reception to "Lulu" was seen to have damaged Lou Reed's reputation and creative output. Reed himself admitted that the album was "perfection," but he was also proud of their collaboration and considered it a bold exploration of artistic boundaries.
